definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call

sentences.english: Hence the terrified wrinkle of those brows; hence all those great souls surrendering their swords.
sentences.chinese: 因此萬衆俯首戰慄，因此心靈偉大的人也全交劍投降。

sentences.english: She wanted her boyfriend to lick her feet all the time.
sentences.chinese: 她想讓她的男朋友總是對她俯首帖耳。

sentences.english: She wanted her husband to lick her boots all the time.
sentences.chinese: 她想要她丈夫一直對她俯首聽命。

sentences.english: I have met the enemy and brought him to his knees.
sentences.chinese: 我已遭遇到敵手，並使他俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: There are many small countries bow their head to Da T'ang at that time.
sentences.chinese: 當時大唐周邊許多小國甘願俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: And toiling in dust, get our life-long dream feed?
sentences.chinese: 俯首於塵土之中，一生的夢想我們該如何實現？

sentences.english: Natural color has given way to such Bright-colored artificial dyestuff in effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 面對如此色彩斑斕的人工染料，自然色彩已俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: The pride of the black cats as girls, waiting for you to kneel.
sentences.chinese: 黑貓的驕傲如同女生，等待你來俯首稱臣。

sentences.english: Now he kowtows to the country where mandatory abortion is required.
sentences.chinese: 現在他對一個要求強制流產的國家俯首帖耳。

sentences.english: The peasants owed service and obedience to their overlord.
sentences.chinese: 農民要俯首貼耳爲地主效勞。

sentences.english: He alone sinks to the rear and the slaves!
sentences.chinese: 他自甘墮落成俯首貼耳的奴隸。

sentences.english: A：I want to marry a man who will wait on me hand and foot.
sentences.chinese: 我想嫁給一個能對我俯首帖耳的男人。

sentences.english: The Supreme Court cannot hand down dicta and simply expect the people to obey.
sentences.chinese: 最高法院不可能指望人們對法官的裁決俯首聽命。
有些人在金錢面前俯首貼耳。

sentences.english: Don't toe the line just as it is grotesque , left to the mercy of it.
sentences.chinese: 不要因它怪誕就俯首聽命，聽任它的擺佈。

sentences.english: You'd better manage to subjugate him.Otherwise it will be all over with you.
sentences.chinese: 你得設法讓他俯首帖耳，否則的話你就完了。

definition: to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel as in prayer (without sitting back on the heels)
to have one's hands tied/helpless/unable to do anything about it
to lean over/to bend over/to stoop/to bow
